body:
FYI this seems to be happening to me once or twice a day as well. Laptop node (Linux) will show server node (Linux) at 100% but in blue and all repositories green. Server node will show laptop node green, and will show all repos as green but one repo will show as perhaps 99% complete with one or more files listed with the 'out of sync' link. Restarting the server node completes the sync. I've let it sit for several hours by itself and it never finishes without the restart.

Do you need more logs for this or are the logs @alex2108 provided sufficient?

Thanks,
Scott

More logs needed, unfortunately. And from 0.9.5 preferably, there's a few relevant database fixes in there, although mostly related to Windows. The one above looks for all the world like a node happily in sync with the environment. Any pattern to what files are out of sync?
i don't see any pattern there, many different kinds of files in different repos, i will see if i can get another log with 0.9.5
Which STTRACE flags do you need for this?

I encounted the problem this evening after resuming from standby. v0.9.5. I am pretty sure 0.9.4 exhibited this without the computer going into standby. Will continue running with logging enabled tomorrow.

23:44
Wake up from standby
Out of sync but not transmitting
Node B shows: 
  Global Repository 313 items, ~78.5 MiB
  Local Repository  312 items, ~67.7 MiB
  Out Of Sync         4 items, ~47.5 MiB
Interestingly the numbers don't add up - possibly because Out of Sync is counting entire files when it will only need to transmit the ending 10MiB of the file.

23:52
Restart syncthing, syncthing synchronizes all nodes

00:01 
Put computer on standby for 30 seconds, when resumed syncthing reconnected and began synchronization

The files being synchronized are append-only ascii log files. Windows Server 2008 to Windows 7.

Logs from NodeB (server names and ip addresses changed):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1187645/syncthing-issue483-node-b.txt

Yeah, there's something broken there, I'll see what I can extract from that log.

(Also, that file changes all the time, so syncthing will be variously in and out of sync continuously on a one-minute cycle.)

Started it up again at 11:30am this morning. Took a look at 11:50 and noticed it Out of Sync again. I watched it for a minute and it did not change. When it is working I see the title bars flicker to a different color then back to geen for most of the time.  Computer was in use - it did not go into standby.  Let me know there is anything else I can do to help.

Logs:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1187645/syncthing-issue483-node-b-2.txt

So the problem here is in a blob of code that's genuinely sucky and in need of refactoring... But until that's done...

@brianlow If you're on Linux or Mac, and this happens, can you do a `pkill -QUIT syncthing`? You'll get a nice log backtrace of all the routines and what they're doing. I'm really interested in what the puller routine thinks it's doing at this point.
Sorry, I am Windows to Windows.

Got the trace from pkill -QUIT (sorry, still on 0.9.4). http://sprunge.us/EYVe

Scott

another 2 pkill -QUIT logs
raspberry pi with 0.9.15: https://gist.github.com/alex2108/70a7c5f6577991b412af
centos with self compiled master (at 0.9.15 or some commits later) https://gist.github.com/alex2108/fb4ca72cf4a7fefb1ebd
Thanks. I now understand what happens, but not yet why. But that's still 50% there!

I think I'm having a similar problem (windows-windows). Remote node won't sync with local node and all local repos are idle. Restart of local node doesn't help. The nodes are in contact (connected with the occasional 6bps upload and download) but are not transferring any files past 50%.

I can't get to the remote node currently but I can try later today. It's an old netbook with 1gb RAM so that might not be helping the problem.

It seems that this starts most frequently with small files changes (maildir emails, git objects, etc). But then those are my most freqently syncd items, so it may be biased :)

Also, the repository rescan button doesn't help...you actually have to restart the affected node.

Changes on a repo are not necessary to get the bug, i had this on a repo at initial sync without any changes to the files. I got it after putting the pc to standby and after a reconnect to other nodes the state was idle with still needed files.
I hope that was the one...

issue.title: Failure To Sync On Newer Versions

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I was happily using syncthing-linux-386-v0.8.7 and then the other end of my connection upgraded to syncthing-linux-386-v0.9.4 which stopped my updates. I then updated to that too, still nothing. We then both upgraded to syncthing-linux-386-v0.9.5 and I now only get updates to files by restarting my syncthing with ctrl-C and relaunch (reboots via UI may work too, didn't try)

Caused by new settings being wrong/corrupt? Caused by what? 0.8.7 worked flawlessly for months once we got it working at all. Issues with "no updates" only started with upgrade to 0.9.4+ but may be present in intermediate versions too.

This could be a duplicate, I didn't check 54 other issues to find out. Please advise, link, close, fix, whatever suits :-)
